net.objectzoo.delegates.adapters
Class ActionXAsyncToDynamicActionAsync

java.lang.Object
  net.objectzoo.delegates.adapters.ActionXAsyncToDynamicActionAsync
All Implemented Interfaces:
DynamicActionAsync
public class ActionXAsyncToDynamicActionAsync
extends Object
implements DynamicActionAsync

This adapter converts a given ActionXAsync to a DynamicActionAsync. The calls to the DynamicActionAsync.beginDynamicInvoke(ActionAsyncCallback, Object, Object...) method are forwarded to the original action's beginInvoke method. If a call to beginDynamicInvoke has the wrong argument count regarding the original action an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Author:
tilmann

Method Detail

beginDynamicInvoke

public ActionAsyncResult beginDynamicInvoke(ActionAsyncCallback callback,
                                            Object asyncState,
                                            Object... params)
Asynchronously invoke this DynamicActionAsync with the given parameter values, callback and asyncState. Associated with each call to beginDynamicInvoke is an ActionAsyncCallback instance returned by the call and given to the callback that can be used to track the status and outcome of the invocation.

Specified by:
beginDynamicInvoke in interface DynamicActionAsync
Parameters:
callback - the ActionAsyncCallback, if given to beginDynamicInvoke, is invoked upon completion of the DynamicActionAsync's invocation and receives the same ActionAsyncResult that is returned by the call to beginDynamicInvoke.
asyncState - the asyncState is an arbitrary reference that, if given to beginDynamicInvoke, can be retrieved from this invocations ActionAsyncResult.getAsyncState()
params - the parameter values for the invocation
Returns:
the ActionAsyncResult associated with this asynchronous invocation
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter count given to this method does not match the parameter count of the underlying original action.
